# PDFAnnotationFreeText

**Class**

A `PDFAnnotationFreeText` object displays text on a page.

## Declaration

```swift
class PDFAnnotationFreeText
```

## Overview

Unlike a `PDFAnnotationText` object, a `PDFAnnotationFreeText` object has no open or closed state; its text is always visible. The text annotation performed in Preview uses `PDFAnnotationFreeText`.

The `PDFAnnotation` class’s [doc://com.apple.pdfkit/documentation/PDFKit/PDFAnnotation/contents] property lets you get and set the textual content for a `PDFAnnotationFreeText` object.

## Managing Text Alignment

- **alignment()**: Returns the horizontal alignment of text within the bounds of the annotation.
- **setAlignment(_:)**: Sets the horizontal alignment of text within the bounds of the annotation.

## Managing Font and Font Color

- **font()**: Returns the font used for the annotation’s text field.
- **setFont(_:)**: Sets the font used in the text field of the annotation.
- **fontColor()**: Returns the font color used in the text field of the annotation.
- **setFontColor(_:)**: Sets the font color used in the text field of the annotation.

## Deprecated Annotation Types

- **PDFAnnotationButtonWidget**: A `PDFAnnotationButtonWidget` object provides user interactivity on a page of a PDF document. There are three types of buttons available: push button, radio button, and checkbox.
- **PDFAnnotationChoiceWidget**: A `PDFAnnotationChoiceWidget` object provides user interactivity on a page of a PDF document, in the form of pop-up menus and lists.
- **PDFAnnotationCircle**
- **PDFAnnotationInk**
- **PDFAnnotationLine**: A `PDFAnnotationLine` object displays a single line on a page.
- **PDFAnnotationLink**
- **PDFAnnotationMarkup**: A `PDFAnnotationMarkup` object appears as highlighting, underlining, or a strikethrough style applied to the text of a document.
- **PDFAnnotationPopup**: A `PDFAnnotationPopup` object provides user interactivity on a PDF page in the form of a pop-up menu.
- **PDFAnnotationSquare**: A rectangle annotation on a page.
- **PDFAnnotationStamp**: A `PDFAnnotationStamp` object allows you to display a word or phrase, such as “Confidential,” in a PDF page.
- **PDFAnnotationText**: A `PDFAnnotationText` object displays as an icon (such as a “sticky note”) attached to a specified point in the PDF document.
- **PDFAnnotationTextWidget**: A `PDFAnnotationTextWidget` object allows you to manage the appearance and content of text fields.

## Inherits From

- PDFAnnotation

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
